meanings.definition: The characteristic taste or smell of something.
meanings.sent1: The cake had a sweet savours of vanilla and chocolate.
meanings.sent2: I love the savours of fresh herbs in my cooking.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious savours of the old house intrigued the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The savours of success lingered in the air after the team's victory.
meanings.sent5: The savours of the ocean breeze brought back memories of childhood vacations.

meanings.sent1: She savours every moment spent with her family.
meanings.sent2: I savours the beauty of nature during my morning walks.
meanings.sent3: He savours the taste of victory after a hard-fought game.
meanings.sent4: The artist savours the process of creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: They savours the peace and quiet of the countryside retreat.

meanings.definition: To have a particular taste or smell.
meanings.sent1: The soup savours of garlic and herbs.
meanings.sent2: The air savours of rain before a storm.
meanings.sent3: The cake savours of burnt sugar, a result of overbaking.
meanings.sent4: The stew savours of a blend of spices and vegetables.
meanings.sent5: The perfume savours of delicate flowers and citrus notes.
